Hi, everyone, new here to the whole KSP thing. Fun game good to see an active community for it.

Anyway, I was looking to mess around some while listening to a daily podcast but cannot for the life of me figure out how to mute the sound. Either I can't find the option for it or that function isn't implemented into the build yet. Does anyone know where the option is? or any possible ways of muting the sound in game?

... option for it or that function isn't implemented into the build yet.

Nailed that one on the first try! ;D

Welcome to the KSP forums Jonathan!

Cheers!

Skunky
Remember though, from the desktop, you can open the sound mixer and turn KSP way down or mute it. Window's got you covered. If you full-screen you'll need to alt-tab out though.

Win7 can change volume for certain applications alone.

I'll second the appeal for a volume control (another XP user here). Just a setting in the startup screen (like the screen resolution) would help a lot: KSP launches are the loudest noises my computer ever makes, which can be unfortunate if I fire up the game at midnight having just watched a fairly quiet video...
When I read 'volume control' my instinct was 'change the size to alter the volume of mass'. Either way, this does need to be addressed. Engines are rather noisy...

Personally, I like the idea that these rockets are ridiculously loud, because that's actually how it works. That being said, while the levels aren't usually too extreme, it would be useful to have an in-game volume control.

A setting for volume control is planned for the settings page once it's complete. For now we just have to bear with it.
